Package javelin.controller.generator.encounter

Class EncounterGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.generator.encounter.EncounterGenerator
  • public class EncounterGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates an Encounter. If I'm not mistaken when manually converting Organization data on monster.xml to a parseable format I only included monster groups up to 16 strong - anything other than that for generated encounters will need to be worked upon or done through other means than only this class.
    Author:
    alex

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public static Combatants generate​(int el,
                                  java.util.List<Terrain> terrains)
                           throws GaveUp
        Parameters:
        el - Target encounter level - will work around this is cannot generate exactly what is given.
        terrains - Usually Terrain.current() but not necessarily - for example not when generation a Location.garrison, which uses the local terrain instead.
        Returns:
        Enemy units for an encounter.
        Throws:
        GaveUp - After too many tries without result, even relaxing the given EL parameter.

      • getmaxenemynumber

        public static int getmaxenemynumber()
        See EncounterGenerator's main javadoc description for mote info on enemy group size.
        Returns:
        The recommended number of enemies to face at most in one battle. Other modules may differ from this but this is a suggestion to avoid the computer player taking a long time to act while the human player has to wait (for example: 1 human unit against 20 enemies).

      • generate

        public static Combatants generate​(int el,
                                  Terrain terrain)
                           throws GaveUp
        Throws:
        GaveUp
